title.value: Heavy metals content in muscle tissues of silver crucian caught in Minsk water reservoirs [Belarus]
Содержание тяжелых металлов в мышечной ткани карася серебряного из водных объектов г. Минска [Беларусь]

journal.title: Belarus Fish Industry Problems : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Zmachinskij, A.S., International A.D. Sakharov State Ecological Univ., Minsk (Belarus)

abstract.value: Accumulation of heavy metals in animals' organisms, in particular, in fish muscle tissue, appears a serious ecological problem, connected with industrial activity of the human. Urban rivers often represent water reservoirs contaminated with heavy metals. Svisloch River, central river of the Minsk city, appears a recreational zone with amateur fishing popular. Total number of fish, caught in Svisloch River by amateur anglers represents rather great quantity. Sanitary status of the fish, caught in contaminated areas does not correspond to medicinal norms. Therefore, the main goal of the research appears analyzing of the muscle tissue of silver crucian, representing a common bio-indicator object with high ecological valence and toxic resistance level. The common row of decrease of heavy metals concentration in silver crucian muscle tissue caught in the two reservoirs located in the upper and lower fragments of the Svisloch River and in one of the water settling tanks appears the same. 31 chemical elements are discovered in fish muscle tissue. The muscle tissues of silver crucian from the lower fragment of the Svisloch River are contaminated with chemical elements in a greater degree than fish, caught in the upper side of the water reservoir.
